A Nuxt module connecting Nuxt to the Craft CMS SEOmatic plugin

If you're using Nuxt.js with Craft CMS headless then there's a good chance you'll be aiming for some decent SEO. A custom solution would take too much time, so a great alternative is to request the SEO data from
This module grabs the SEOmatic data and converts it to a format that Nuxt.js expects in it's
Before starting, I'll assume you've installed
won't work with SEOmatic as we need to match the URI which gets turned off when headlessMode is enabled.
, be sure to adjust the scope to the right entries in the GraphQL schema - I find it easy to forget that.

yarn add nuxt-seomatic-meta
# or: npm install nuxt-seomatic-meta
Add the seomatic-meta and axios plugins to your modules section in
: Axios is used to connect to the Craft CMS API - it's automatically installed as a dependency of
so you'll just need to add it to the array.
(optional): To specify your GraphQL connection variables in a
Now specify the GraphQL connection settings - you have two options:
a) Add the connection settings to an
file in your project root (if you're using the

# Craft installation url
BACKEND_URL=https://YOUR_DOMAIN

# GraphQL api path
GRAPHQL_PATH=/api

# GraphQL bearer token (Not required if API is public)
GRAPHQL_TOKEN=ACCESS_TOKEN_SECRET
# GraphQL bearer token (Not required if API is public)
b) Or add the connection settings to a new
Lastly, add some code to start the API request and supply the result to Nuxt's head property. This is added to your pages in

<script>
export default {
  //...

  // Get Seomatic data from Craft by route
  async asyncData({ app, route }) {
    const siteId = 1 // For multi-site installs
    return {
      headData: await app.seomaticMeta(route, siteId)
    };
  },

  // Supply the data to the Nuxt head property
  head() {
    return this.headData;
  }
};
</script>
// Get Seomatic data from Craft by route
// Supply the data to the Nuxt head property
